title: At what point will you realize Lee(and balancing the jungle around him) is killing diversity?
body:
When only him and a couple other junglers are remotely viable, something is wrong.  It's mostly the jungle and how it's being tuned more and more to be exclusively for the top tier junglers, but it's also because those top tier junglers are so much better at it that you are effectively gimping your team by trying anything else.

Also, when you added 100 gold to the jungle item to "help the guy who gets killed during an early invade", do you realize you're huring that guy more than the people who killed him?  The guy who got the kill just got a nice bit of gold and xp, and will have much less trouble farming up to his 450 starting jungle item.  The guy who died now has to go clear 3 camps with no leash and a late start and pray that the enemy jungler doesn't come back in for a free kill.  How is this helping the guy who got killed at all if he isn't Lee Sin and able to farm just about whatever he wants?

Honestly, the reason Lee Sin pisses me off so much is he is **literally** the posterboy of a *hundred* things Riot states are horrible for design and go against their design philosophy, but they favor him so goddamn much they just sweep complaints under the carpet.

I could be remembering the wrong Rioter, but I think it was Statikk or Meddler who once said that "champions should have the things they *need*, not the the things they *want*". Lee Sin has ***everything*** he could want *and then some*.

He does *need* a SIXTY percent AOE slow in addition to one of hte best hard CCs and some of (if not *the*) best mobility in the game.

He doesn't *need* insane base damages, execute damage, and crazy scaling (one of which, his ult, is an AOE when used properly. Like wtf.)  when his kit has a billion things in it.

He doesn't *need* built in sustain and an attack speed boost. The list goes on.

I honestly could write a several page essay about all the problems with the champion,  and all the shit that should've been done *ages* ago, but I've already done it *multiple* times over the last few years and Riot still has no interest in changing their favorite champion for the betterment of their game, so there's not much point.

Anything tankier than pure assassin won't *care* about long CDs because he'll live long enough to use them again regardless. And in the jungle, he doesn't *have* to really have fast clears, because his earlygame presence is so ridiculous that unless he's pretty bad/new at either Lee Sin or jungling in general, he's able to bully you in your jungle or just dumpster on your lanes with his just-plain-nuts ganking power.

He can literally run the *entire* gamut between pure assassin and pure tank and be completely effective. That's not okay.

(J4 has similar problems but not nearly as bad)

I think increasing his cds would just make him less oppresive and then he could keep his jack of all trades kit.

His Q cd make him really sticky or allow him to use minions/jungle monsters to escape while dealing huge damages. 

His ultimate is good at too much things for such a low cd. It's a huge nuke, aoe CC, disengage, deplacement and I might forget things.

That's the problem though, his "jack-of-all-trades" kit *can't exist*. It's **horrible** for the game, and will never *ever* be balanced: it'll either be way too strong or completely worthless, because that's just the core of jack-of-all-trades kits in games. It's not a realistically balance-able character type. 

If it's functional, it's going to be better than everything else in the right hands because it has an answer to everything.
If it's not functional, it's.. well.. not functional. You can't use it.

There's no middle ground, it's an (unfortunate) realm of extremes. It just can't be done by the simple definition of what a "jack-of-all-trades" character is. No clearly defined weaknesses is a serious problem, and it's one Lee Sin has.

"That's the problem though, his "jack-of-all-trades" kit can't exist. It's horrible for the game, and will never ever be balanced: it'll either be way too strong or completely worthless, because that's just the core of jack-of-all-trades kits in games"
